jMapViewer
Class DisplayMap

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      jMapViewer.DisplayMap
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants, org.openstreetmap.gui.jmapviewer.interfaces.JMapViewerEventListener
public class DisplayMap
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements org.openstreetmap.gui.jmapviewer.interfaces.JMapViewerEventListener

DisplayMap is the Java class which displays the map for the user. It creates the frame and the elements created by the user on the map.

Version:
1.0 30/01/2014
Author:
Luc Clement, Arnaud Saunier
See Also:
Serialized Form

drawArea

public void drawArea(java.lang.String name,
                     java.awt.Color borderColor,
                     java.awt.Color innerColor,
                     java.util.List<org.openstreetmap.gui.jmapviewer.Coordinate> nodes)
This method permits to draw an area on the map, and to add it to the layerAreas layer.

Parameters:
name - Name of the layer of the area.
borderColor - Color of the border line of the area.
innerColor - Color of the area
nodes - List of nodes which define the boundaries of the area.

removeArea

public void removeArea(java.lang.String name)
This method removes an area from the map

Parameters:
name - Name of the area to remove

drawCircle

public void drawCircle(java.lang.String name,
                       java.awt.Color borderColor,
                       java.awt.Color innerColor,
                       double lat,
                       double lon,
                       double radius)
This method permits to draw a circle on the map, and to add it to the layerCircles layer.

Parameters:
name - Name of the layer of the circle.
borderColor - Color of the border line of the circle.
innerColor - Color of the circle.
lat - the latitude of the center of the circle.
lon - the longitude of the center o the circle.
radius - the radius of the circle.

removeCircle

public void removeCircle(java.lang.String name)
This method removes a circle from the map

Parameters:
name - the name of the circle to remove

drawPoint

public void drawPoint(java.lang.String name,
                      java.awt.Color colorPoint,
                      double lat,
                      double lon)
This method permits to add a dot to the map, and to add it to the layerPoints layer.

Parameters:
name - Name of the layer and the point.
colorPoint - Color of the point
lat - Latitude of the point.
lon - Longitude of the point.

removePoint

public void removePoint(java.lang.String name)
This method removes a point from the map

Parameters:
name - The name of the point to remove

drawToulouseSuburb

public void drawToulouseSuburb(int suburb,
                               int neighbourhood,
                               java.awt.Color borderColor,
                               java.awt.Color color)
                        throws java.io.IOException
This method draw a Toulouse suburb on the map (using the OverPass API)

Parameters:
suburb - The number of the suburb to draw
neighbourhood - The number of the neighbourhood to draw (0 if you want to draw the whole suburb)
borderColor - the border color of the area
color - the inner color of the area
Throws:
java.io.IOException

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
The main method set the map visible.

Parameters:
args -
